text.text: How can I track charge changes?

text:
Sure, I can help you with that. To track charge changes, you can run the **"Trip counts by charge category"** report. This report shows the counts per charge category per month.

To change rates, you can use the **Charges tab**. You can view all rates you entered on this tab. Editing a rate does not affect existing claims. The new rate will be applied to new claims after the change.

To create a charge group, you can use the **Charges tab**. You can also use the **Claim page** to enter a custom rate.

text.text: What report should I run to monitor charge changes?

text:
To track charge changes, you can run the **"Trip counts by charge category"** report. This report shows the counts per charge category per month.

To change rates, you can use the **Charges tab**. You can view all rates you entered on this tab. Editing a rate does not affect existing claims. The new rate will be applied to new claims after the change.

text.text: What information does Page 1 of the "Trip counts by charge category" report display?

text: Page 1 of the "Trip counts by charge category" report shows the **counts per charge category per month**.

text.text: Can you describe the details available on Page 2 of the report?

text: Page 2 of the "Trip counts by charge category" report shows the **total charges**, including mileage, date of service, claim number, claim status, charges, and balances.

text.text: How frequently should I run the "Trip counts by charge category" report to effectively track charge changes?

text: I would recommend running the report **daily** to help identify your projected revenue, trends by LOS or month, and total trips by week/month/quarter/year.

To track charge changes, you can run the "Trip counts by charge category" report. Page 1 shows the **counts per charge category per month**. Page 2 shows the **total charges**, including mileage, date of service, claim number, claim status, charges, and balances.
